sentence.Network_en: Why were grown-ups always so stuffy and slow to recognize good ideas?

jx.jx_en_mean: not quick but achieving the required result eventually

lj.lj_ly: I am making good progress—slow but sure.
lj.lj_ls: 我一直都在进步——慢但却很稳。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English slāw 'slow-witted, sluggish', of Germanic origin

entry.def: Something that is slow moves, happens, or is done without much speed.

example.ex: The traffic is heavy and slow...
Electric whisks should be used on a slow speed.
example.tran: 使用自动搅拌器时应该选用慢挡。

entry.tran: (用于非正式英语中)缓慢地，慢吞吞地
entry.def: In informal English, slower is used to mean 'at a slower speed' and slowest is used to mean 'at the slowest speed'. In non-standard English, slow is used to mean 'with little speed'.

example.ex: I began to walk slower and slower...
We got there by driving slow all the way.
example.tran: 我们开着车去了那里，一路上开得很慢。

entry.tran: 费时间的;时间长的;迟缓的
entry.def: Something that is slow takes a long time.

example.ex: The distribution of passports has been a slow process.
example.tran: 颁发护照的过程非常缓慢。

entry.def: If someone is slow to do something, they do it after a delay.

example.ex: The world community has been slow to respond to the crisis...
example.tran: 国际社会对这次危机反应迟缓。

example.ex: I've been a bit slow in making up my mind.

entry.def: If something slows or if you slow it, it starts to move or happen more slowly.

example.ex: The rate of bombing has slowed considerably...
example.tran: 轰炸的速度明显慢了下来。

example.ex: She slowed the car and began driving up a narrow road...
example.tran: 她放慢车速，开始驶上一条狭窄的道路。

entry.def: Someone who is slow is not very clever and takes a long time to understand things.

example.ex: He got hit on the head and he's been a bit slow since.
example.tran: 他的脑袋受过撞击，从那以后，他的反应变得有些迟钝。

entry.tran: 呆滞的;不景气的;沉闷的
entry.def: If you describe a situation, place, or activity as slow, you mean that it is not very exciting.

example.ex: Don't be faint-hearted when things seem a bit slow or boring...
example.tran: 事情变得有点沉闷无聊的时候，不要胆怯。

example.ex: The island is too slow for her liking.
example.tran: 这个岛太沉闷了，不合她的胃口。

entry.def: If a clock or watch is slow, it shows a time that is earlier than the correct time.

means.word_mean: 1. not moving quickly; taking a comparatively long time;

sentences.sentence: "he was slow in reacting to the news"

means.word_mean: 3. slow to learn or understand; lacking intellectual acuity;

sentences.sentence: "so dense he never understands anything I say to him"
"although dull at classical learning, at mathematics he was uncommonly quick"- Thackeray
"dumb officials make some really dumb decisions"
"he was either normally stupid or being deliberately obtuse"

means.word_mean: 4. (used of timepieces) indicating a time earlier than the correct time;
5. so lacking in interest as to cause mental weariness;

sentences.sentence: "the deadening effect of some routine tasks"
"a ho-hum speaker who couldn't capture their attention"
"what an irksome task the writing of long letters is"- Edmund Burke
"the tiresome chirping of a cricket"- Mark Twain

means.word_mean: 1. without speed (`slow' is sometimes used informally for `slowly');

sentences.sentence: "please go slow so I can see the sights"
"the clock is almost an hour slow"

auth_sentence.content: The deposit - loan cycle pace is very slow.
auth_sentence.res_content: The deposit - loan cycle pace is very slow.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The deposit - loan cycle pace is very slow.

auth_sentence.content: This generation of the route was a slow process.
auth_sentence.res_content: This generation of the route was a slow process.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This generation of the route was a slow process.

auth_sentence.content: The Crookes better hold attentions when they slow down.
auth_sentence.res_content: The Crookes better hold attentions when they slow down.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Crookes better hold attentions when they slow down.

Sentence.sentence: They tend to be slow in confronting new challenges.
Well, the sign on my store says the hours are ten to six, but if business is slower than usual, I can just lock up and take off early.
And he always starts his sentence by saying, " Wow, your chops were slow
Its process will not slow down.
It is a trend that shows no sign of slowing.
And most of the time they hardly slowed her down.

sentences.en: This is the slow lane of a motorway.

means.word_mean: 迟钝的; 不灵巧的,笨的；理解力差的

sentences.en: I'm sorry I'm so slow today, I didn't get much sleep last night.
sentences.cn: 对不起, 我今天反应太迟钝, 我昨天晚上没睡多少觉。

means.word_mean: (生意等)清淡的; 不忙碌的,冷清的

sentences.en: How slow would you like me to play?
The river slows on the flat bottom.
sentences.cn: 河水在平坦的河床上减慢了流速。

sentences.en: She slowed the car to a crawl.

jushi.chinese: 那是种慢慢发作的毒药。

jushi.english: He caught the slow train to Birmingham.
jushi.chinese: 他赶上去伯明翰的慢车。

jushi.english: This is the slow lane of a motorway.
jushi.chinese: 这是高速公路的慢车道。
